newsitem.title: USA: Orange County, Calif., voters reject two taxes.
newsitem.headline: Orange County, Calif., voters reject two taxes.

text.p: Voters in two Orange County, Calif., cities defeated local tax measures in Tuesday's election, city officials said.
San Clemente's 2.5 percent utility tax was rejected with nearly 59 percent of the vote opposed to the measure.
Voters also defeated Stanton's $16.88-a-month public safety charge, with 71.5 percent voting against the measure.
The two levies were placed on the ballot because of California's Proposition 218, which strengthened existing law to require that all new local taxes be submitted to voters for approval.
